bill.title: Child abuse; provide penalties for false reports and enact child protection measures.
bill.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-21-353, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create A Criminal Penalty And Civil Action For Falsely Reporting To The Department Of Human Services That Another Has Abused Or Neglected A Child, Knowing Such Report To Be False, And To Clarify The Required Contents Of Reports Of Child Abuse Or Neglect; To Require The Bureau Of Vital Statistics Of The State Board Of Health To Notify The Department Of Human Services And District Attorneys When It Appears That A Minor Below The Age Of Consent Has Conceived A Child As The Result Of Statutory Rape Or Sexual Battery; To Provide A Duty To Report Such Facts On Licensed Educational Personnel; To Provide For Immunity For Making Such Reports; To Create The "mississippi Child Protection Act Of 2010"; To Provide For The Mandatory Reporting Of Sexual Crimes Against Minors; To Provide For The Retaining Of The Dna Of A Fetus For The Purpose Of Documenting The Perpetrator Of A Sex Crime Against A Minor; To Create A Civil Action For Causing, Aiding Or Assisting A Minor To Obtain An Abortion; And For Related Purposes.
